Articles.Content:
The flying box/dropship in the background brought all modules. The dropship has to cargo floors with working elevator and door. All stock parts, but kerbal joint reinforcement is used to keep struts down. Video coming soon!

Javascript is disabled. View full album
Holy Crap! So that other one was pretty much just a proof of concept, now you're making the real deal!!
Very nice. Is that thing single stage or is there a separate launcher segment? Do ypu know if it will hold together in stock physics.
Holy mother of... How? Can't wait to see a video of how the elevator and stuff work.

You did what? In Stock?

Also I like how the walls are made of kerbodyne fuel tanks, so Kerbal.
Rover wheels as elevator actuators? That can't possibly w- oh, what? It works?

Its ssto launch on kerbin. need refueling in orbit which takes ages because its 1130 parts unloaded. Nukes give it enough delta v to go anywhere, but depending where you go you may need a fuel depot in orbit at the landing planet. It can also lift 100 tons worth of cargo.

Edited February 23, 2015 by Kianykin
Build bigger, my brother. It's good to see others taking up the torch in my negligent absence. ^^

That's not colonizing.

That's CONQUERING.
My god! No matter which picture I look at, I always see my computer lagging!

wow, now that's a dropship... whackjob-worth.

take a look at ubiozurs partwelding mod. it allows to merge parts into larger structures which greatly reduces the partcount. there are just a few designrules.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/107273
Man, that looks very kerbal

That's not colonizing.

That's CONQUERING.

Agreed!

Wow, Kianykin, you are my hero O.o

This is awe inspiring amazing goodness.

Well played sir!

For the time being im using a dedicated landing vehicle that can either support or suspend the payload, it lands, lets go of cargo and either takes off again immediately or will a touch and go and land nearby.

Nothing compaired to that.

I likes

EDIT: Your not using kerbal attachment system! what the... You've done this is stock. I see kerbodyn engines but.. but.. no kas. That is even more of a breathtakingly remarkable creation.

Edited February 23, 2015 by keeper

How did you lift that thing to orbit?

(I'll assume that's not career mode)
Awesome stuff!

Hey, a Base-In-A-Box! I thought I was the only one that did those things. Now, I'll gladly admit, yours certainly takes the crown in sheer complexity and probably downright awesomeness. But then again, mine is expandable into glory and, you know, actually playable.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Rune. I'll be sure to rep when I get home to a computer!

Clicked out of curiosity.

Seen pictures.

Checked OP's name if its Whackjob.

Found out that it is not.

Eyebrow risen...

Nice little ship you got there...
Holy crap, that is awesome

Holy mother of... How? Can't wait to see a video of how the elevator and stuff work.

My thoughts exactly
link to video of this dropship http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/111607-DS-2-Mun-Landing
nice
very impressive. Your creativity and ingenuity surpasses my own considerably.
Outstanding.
That thing is in super-size form what I do with cargo bays. I've used every inch of space of those things to place cargo and ship-critical parts like RCS fuel.
